org.lucidfox.jpromises.gwt

Class JsThenable<V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject
      • org.lucidfox.jpromises.gwt.JsThenable<V>
  • Type Parameters:
    V - the value type
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Thenable<V>

    @GwtCompatible
public class JsThenable<V>
extends com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject
implements Thenable<V>

    A wrapper for a native JavaScript thenable satisfying the Promises/A+ specification - for example, a JQuery Deferred object or a Promise as implemented natively by modern browsers.

    This class enables GWT code to mix Java promises with JavaScript thenables. To cast an arbitrary JavaScriptObject to a JsThenable, use the JavaScriptObject.cast() method: 

     JsThenable<ValueType> thenable = javaScriptObject.cast();

    • Method Detail

      • then

        public <R> JsThenable<R> then(ResolveCallback<? super V,R> onResolve,
                              RejectCallback<R> onReject)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: Thenable

        Specifies code to be run after the thenable is resolved (either to a value, or a rejection exception).

        After the callbacks are registered using then, if the thenable's computation completes successfully, it must call onResolve with the computed value. If it fails, it must call onReject with the rejection reason (exception). Only one of these callbacks must be called, and only once.

        If either callback is null, or returns a null promise, the thenable returned by the method must in turn be resolved or rejected, depending on whether this thenable was resolved or rejected. If a valid promise was returned, the thenable returned by this method must be chained after the returned promise.

        Implementors are encouraged to override the return type with their implementation class and restrict the range of exceptions potentially thrown by this method.

        Specified by:
        then in interface Thenable<V>
        Type Parameters:
        R - the type of the result promise
        Parameters:
        onResolve - the resolve callback (optional)
        onReject - the reject callback (optional)
        Returns:
        (optionally) a Thenable that is chained after the current thenable
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Optionally, Thenable can throw exceptions, though its main implementation, Promise, does not. The Promise class treats thrown exceptions as rejection.
